newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Nizhnetagilsk Metal plans credit for Voest plant.
newsitem.headline: Nizhnetagilsk Metal plans credit for Voest plant.

text.p: One of Russia's leading steel makers, Nizhnetagilsk Metal, and Austria's Voest-Alpine AG will shortly sign a $65 million framework deal for continuous steel production equipment, a bank official said on Wednesday.

AO Nizhnetagilsky Metallurgichesky Kombinat (NTMK) has already paid $25 million from its own funds for the equipment and the rest of the sum will come from a $40 million credit from Germany's Bayerische Landesbank-Girozentrale with Inkombank participation, Inkombank's Yekaterinburg branch manager Alexander Paramonov told Reuters by telephone.
The $40 million credit will represent the first tranche of a $152 million 10-year credit from Bayerische Landesbank at eight percent annual interest, he said.
Inkombank is the agent bank for the credit.
A second tranche will be used to buy equipment for another production line at NTMK.
Russia's central bank must give Inkombank permission to undertake capital movements for the agreement to go ahead. --Natalya Shurina, Moscow Newsroom, +7095 941 8520
